Key Match Events: Cody Bellinger hit a two-run home run off Walker Buehler four batters into the game.
Michael Busch added a home run among four hits and three RBIs as the Cubs found some offense to earn a 10-4 victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers are looking for a viable No. 2 starter as October approaches, with another candidate set to step forward Tuesday when right-hander Yoshinobu Yamamoto is expected to return from the injured list.
Post-Match Reflections: Walker Buehler called the outing “unacceptable,” but teammate Freddie Freeman was quick to jump to the right-hander’s defense.

Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said. “I thought the stuff was good. The fastball velocity, there was some swing-and-miss in there. The slider at times was good and the cutter was good at times. Just overall, the command wasn’t quite there.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani’s 47th stolen base as he inched closer to the first 50-50 season in MLB history.
The Cubs managed to score just two total runs during a three-game series against the New York Yankees this past weekend.
Others: Buehler has been saying he feels more and more like himself after each start, but Monday’s outing failed to match his building confidence.
Buehler has yet to show he can get up to speed from the outset.
